cyclone.name: PETER
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles E of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest for the next day, then curving northwest and slowing, passing north of the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico before turning farther north toward open Atlantic waters south of Bermuda.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico coasts likely to feel fringe effects as Peter passes just to the north.
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) possible in outer squalls as the center passes north of the island.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected because the center tracks well north and winds remain below gale force along the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated higher amounts could trigger urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along north-facing beaches beginning Monday.
